description: Borrowed from French marocain (“Moroccan”), from Maroc (“Morocco”) (from Medieval Latin Marrochium (“the city of Marrakech, the former capital of Morocco”), ultimately from Berber Murt n Akush (“Land of God”)) + -ain (“suffix forming demonyms”).

entries.meaning: A heavy crepe fabric of silk, wool, or both, having a cross-ribbed texture, used for apparel. [from early 20th c.]
